code: easytable(   ...,   model.names = NULL,   output = "word",   export.word = NULL,   export.csv = NULL,   robust.se = FALSE,   control.var = NULL,   margins = FALSE,   highlight = FALSE,   abbreviate = FALSE,   table_size = "normalsize" )

title: Create publication-ready regression tables — easytable
text: ... Statistical model objects (lm glm). Pass models directly like easytable(m1, m2, m3). model.names Character vector custom names model columns. NULL (default), columns named "Model 1", "Model 2", etc. Length must match number models. output Character string specifying output format. One : "word" - Microsoft Word via flextable (default) "latex" - LaTeX PDF output export.word Character string ending .docx Word file export. supported output = "word". NULL (default), file written. export.csv Character string ending .csv CSV export. NULL (default), CSV file written. robust.se Logical. Use robust standard errors (HC type)? Default FALSE. Requires packages: lmtest, sandwich control.var Character vector variable names group "control variables". collapsed single rows showing "Y" presence instead individual coefficients. Default NULL. margins Logical. Compute average marginal effects (AME)? Default FALSE. Requires package: margins highlight Logical. Highlight significant coefficients (positive green, negative red)? Default FALSE. Works best Word output. abbreviate Logical. Abbreviate variable names readability? Default FALSE. TRUE, long variable names shortened using deterministic rules. table_size Character string specifying LaTeX table size. works output = "latex". Options: "tiny", "small", "normalsize", "scriptsize". Default "normalsize". Error used Word output.

title: Create publication-ready regression tables — easytable
text: Depends output: "word" - flextable object "latex" - Character string LaTeX table code

title: Create publication-ready regression tables — easytable
text: function extracts coefficients, standard errors, p-values model, adds significance stars (*** p<.01, ** p<.05, * p<.1), includes model fit statistics (N, R-squared, Adjusted R-squared, AIC). Control variables can grouped show presence/absence rather individual coefficients factor level transformation. Term labels automatically formatted readability: Factor levels separated colon (e.g., advisor_confidence:low) Interactions shown asterisk (e.g., var1 * var2) Polynomial contrasts L indices (e.g., var:L1, var:L2) Long variable names abbreviated clarity

title: Create publication-ready regression tables — easytable
text: Always required: broom, dplyr Word output: flextable LaTeX output: knitr, optionally kableExtra enhanced formatting Robust SE: lmtest, sandwich Marginal effects: margins

title: Create publication-ready regression tables — easytable
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load example data library(palmerpenguins) data(penguins)  # Fit models m1 <- lm(body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm, data = penguins) m2 <- lm(body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm + species, data = penguins) m3 <- lm(body_mass_g ~ flipper_length_mm + species + island, data = penguins)  # Create table with default names (Model 1, Model 2, Model 3) easytable(m1, m2, m3)  # Custom model names easytable(m1, m2, m3, model.names = c("Baseline", "With Species", "Full"))  # LaTeX output easytable(m1, m2, output = "latex")  # With robust standard errors easytable(m1, m2, robust.se = TRUE)  # Group species and island as control variables easytable(m1, m2, m3, control.var = c("species", "island"))  # Export to Word and CSV easytable(m1, m2, export.word = "mytable.docx", export.csv = "mytable.csv") } # }

title: easytable 2.0.1
text: Direct model interface: New easytable() function accepts model objects directly dots, like easytable(m1, m2, m3). provides intuitive API multiple model input. Default model naming: Model columns now automatically named “Model 1”, “Model 2”, etc. using new easytable() interface. Custom model names: Added model.names parameter specify custom column names models. Example: easytable(m1, m2, model.names = c("Baseline", "Full")) Enhanced term label formatting: Term labels now automatically formatted improved readability: Factor levels separated colon (e.g., digital_confidence:low) Interactions displayed asterisk spaces (e.g., var1 * var2) Polynomial contrasts shown L indices (e.g., var:L1 .Q, var:L2 .L) Common variable names abbreviated (e.g., fin.prud financial_prudence)

what: If You Had Issues with Missing Packages
title: easytable 2.0.0
text: Old behavior (0.1.0): New behavior (2.0.0):
code: # Package would auto-install dependencies (security risk!) easy_table(models) # Installing package into '~/R/library'... # Get clear error with installation instructions easy_table(models) # Error: Package 'flextable' is required for Word output. #   Install it with: install.packages('flextable')  # You install once: install.packages("flextable")  # Then use normally: easy_table(models)

what: If You Want Markdown or LaTeX Output
title: easytable 2.0.0
code: # Markdown for Quarto/RMarkdown easy_table(models, output = "markdown")  # LaTeX for PDF easy_table(models, output = "latex")
